Trans. 29.8.94. To proof + bot names.
Melbourne 20/2/72.

I owe you my best thanks, dear and learned Sir, not only for your kindness of forwarding to me the samples of Den[...]ium & of Micinacarpus major, but also for mentioning my name specially in the last preface of your & your great fathers universal work and sending me an authographic inscription for the last volume, the value of which for such a work cannot too highly be esteemed.
refer to work and trans.
Next to Linnés spec. plantarum
reference
the prodromus must always remain the greatest achievement of phytography; and as the material now will become scattered among so many future workers, no work can ever be produced, that can rank equal in importance with the prodromus.

I have examined Demidium & sent notes on it for the current 65th number of the fragmenta to print. Some of the flowers have a few setae of a pappus , and it differs also in not having the [...] involucre from Stuartia. I have now also describeed the anthers.

I shall not fail to send you from time to time contributions to your Herbarium, which must for all times remain one of the most important for consultation. I suppose your London adress is as in former years at Trübners.
